pages.text: Amidst the life-filled swamps, one often encounters death. Such is the embodiment found in the Dead Tree – frequently standing as a skeletal remnant in the bogs, once presumably the trunk of a tall and mighty tree. Many experts note that the form and nature of the fibers suggest these corpses result from the demise of $(l:plants/nameless_tree)Nameless Trees$(/l).
A Dead Tree in typical 'union' with the $(l:plants/swamp_rotfiend)Swamp Rotfiend$(/l) – its common symbiont.

The rotted wood of this tree is not strong enough to be harvested and instead crumbles in the process. $(br)The little that can be collected – the roughened bark – though seemingly useless at first glance, finds several applications in our art. Combined with other components, it forms the basis for creating many useful items.

The rotted wood can become an inviting home for certain insects. Thus, a special kind of tree larva is often found when felling dead trees. Their small, repugnant bodies harbor unique magic, which an experienced wizard can extract and use to their advantage. Extracted larvae die and lose their power over time, conservation is the best way to prevent this.
